# Stefany Coxe {.unlisted .unnumbered}
## Associate Professor, Quantitative Psychology {.unlisted .unnumbered}
## Department of Psychology, Florida International University {.unlisted .unnumbered}

***

## Research interests

My research focuses on **evaluating** and **applying** advanced statistical methods to behavioral data. Behavioral data displays certain qualities (e.g., categorical variables, non-normally distributed variables, frequent clustering of individuals within families, schools, or neighborhoods, missing values) that require specialized statistical methods and approaches.

Thesis: Effect of first language on syntactic priming in a second language  

**B.S., Cognitive Psychology**  
[University of California, San Diego](https://psychology.ucsd.edu/)   
Thesis: Syntactic priming in beginning and advanced speakers of a second language
